title.narrative: Provide Life-Saving protection and sexual reproductive interventions through drought response areas in five target provinces of southern Angola (Cunene, Namibe, Huila, Benguela and Huambo).

description.narrative: This UNFPA project will provide Life-Saving protection and sexual reproductive interventions through drought response areas in five target provinces of southern Angola (Cunene, Namibe, Huila, Benguela, and Huambo). UNFPA and its implementing partners will provide Safe spaces and core Gender-Based Violence services by providing menstrual hygiene management or dignity kits. UNFPA will also provide inter-agency emergency reproductive health services enabled in the five drought-affected Provinces targeting 13,337 pregnant women by distributing 60 birth attendant delivery kits and gender-based violence (GBV) interventions. In total, 143,837 persons will benefit, including 30,000 men,100,000 women, 2,000 boys and 38,837 girls.UNFPA also expects to reach 389 people with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS ANGOLA RAPID RESPONSE DROUGHT 2021

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: 113,337 pregnant women assisted with Clean Delivery Kits in the drought-affected municipalities.
SP.2a Number of inter-agency emergency reproductive health kits delivered (clean delivery kits - birth attendant 2B distributed in health clinics in target areas)
SP.2b Number of people benefiting from services enabled by inter-agency emergency reproductive health kits (pregnant women who receive Clean Delivery Kits- individual 2A in target areas.)
Effective Monitoring of Project activities & achievements ensured

AP.4a Number of affected people who state that the assistance and protection provided correspond with their needs (through the Monitoring visits by UNFPA CO staff to drought-affected areas (It is estimated that at least 1/6 of these beneficiaries, i.e. 23,973 people, will testify to the relevance of life-saving actions carried out by UNFPA in the provinces of Cunene, Huila, Namibe, Benguela and Huambo))
Inter-agency emergency reproductive health life-saving services to beneficiaries ensured in the five drought-affected Provinces.
Awareness sessions conducted by the Local Project Field Assistants - LPFAs - (30 sessions per Municipality x 26 = 780
SP.2b Number of people benefiting from services enabled by inter-agency emergency reproductive health kits (in the five drought-affected Provinces)
Safe spaces and core Gender Based Violence life-saving services ensured in the target drought affected areas.
SP.1a Number of menstrual hygiene management kits and/or dignity kits distributed
